title.narrative: Support for the transition from the Emission Standard Euro 4/IV to Euro 6/VI in Morocco

description.narrative: Aware of the elevated air pollution, its related socio-economic problems, and its causes, Morocco applied the Euro 4/IV emission standard for imported vehicles starting in 2011 and for locally produced vehicles starting in 2015. Although better than the previous emission standards, the Euro 4/IV emission standard does not achieve the expected emission reductions under real-world driving conditions, particularly in urban areas settings with low-speed and low-load. Taking this context into account and to accelerate the reduction of air pollutants from transport, the Government of Morocco aims to leapfrog from the Euro 4/IV to the Euro 6/VI emission standard by 2022.

GGGI aims to assist METLE and the National Center for Testing and Homologation (CNEH) to implement the Euro 6/VI standard by January 1, 2022. GGGI’s support will be composed of 2 stages.
Stage 1 – Assessment of the expected benefits and costs associated with the transition to Euro 6/VI
To provide a sound rationale for the transition to the Euro 6/VI emission standard, this stage will assess the expected benefits from the transition. The potential reduction in air pollutants will be estimated. Other potential benefits from the economic, environmental, and social perspectives will also be examined. The cost will include required investments to bring the sector up to the EUR6/VI standards, in terms of fuel and fuel storage, vehicle production, etc. This stage will also assess if the transition would cause any significant costs to society.
Stage 2 – Development of an implementation plan for Euro 6/VI
Given the decision made by the Government of Morocco to transition to the Euro 6 / VI standard in 2022, and with the aim of working to ensure that this transition takes place under optimal conditions, a practical implementation and communication plan for this Euro 6/VI standard will be developed in close consultation with METLE and CNEH. In doing so, examples of other countries which leapfrogged from Euro 4/IV to Euro 6/VI will be referenced to gain insights and learn best practices. In addition, the process of introducing Euro 4/IV in Morocco will be critically reviewed so that difficulties similar to those faced by the government could be avoided when Euro 6/VI is rolled out. Stakeholders including vehicle manufactures, auto dealers, and consumer advocates will be consulted to reflect their views in the implementation plan to the extent possible.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04540 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: GHG emissions and air pollution from transport sector reduced, contributing to achievement of Morocco's NDC, SDG and national development commitments

description.narrative: NSDS, NDC, and SDG progress reports

title.narrative: Program contributes to 9.5% of Morocco's NDC target of reducing GHG emissions by 42% below BAU by 2030 (9.5% relates to transport sector's share)
Program contributes to reduced air pollutants emitted by vehicles
Transition to Eur4-Eur6 implementation plan developed
Eur6 implementation plan designed and submitted to METLE
Monitoring and adjustment of implementation plan conducted

description.narrative: Public communications or from METLE demonstrating system operalization

title.narrative: Monitoring and adjustment of implementation plan conducted
Eur4-Eur6 transition implementaion plan is endorsed, funded and implemented

description.narrative: Pulic communications or from METLE demonstrating implementation of the standard
Record of written submission from METLE
Record of written submission or budget publications from MOF

title.narrative: METLE implements the Eur4-Eur6 transition plan (01-01-2022)
METLE makes a budget submission to MOF for a Eur4 - Eur6 transition implementation plan that incorporates elements of GGGI's design (31-07-2021)
MOF approves budget for the Eur4-Eur6 transition (31-12-2021)
